meanings.definition: A person who participates in a stampede.
meanings.sent1: During the stampede, the stampeders ran quickly to safety.
meanings.sent2: The stampeders hurried to escape the sudden rush of animals.
meanings.sent3: The stampeders laughed as they raced each other to the finish line.
meanings.sent4: The stampeders were like a herd of wild horses, galloping through the field.
meanings.sent5: The image of the stampeders fleeing in panic was etched in his mind.

meanings.definition: A group of people who rush or crowd in a sudden, frenzied way.
meanings.sent1: The stampeders pushed and shoved to get to the front of the line.
meanings.sent2: In the chaos, the stampeders jostled each other to reach the exit.
meanings.sent3: The stampeders eagerly surged forward to grab the last piece of cake.
meanings.sent4: The stampeders flooded the store like a wave crashing on the shore.
meanings.sent5: The sight of the stampeders scrambling for bargains was unforgettable.

meanings.definition: A team or group of individuals who compete in a race or contest.
meanings.sent1: The stampeders trained hard to win the relay race.
meanings.sent2: The stampeders lined up at the starting point, ready to sprint.
meanings.sent3: The stampeders cheered on their teammates as they raced to the finish.
meanings.sent4: The stampeders were determined to outpace their rivals in the competition.
meanings.sent5: The stampeders' victory in the tournament was celebrated by all.
